Title:
Molecular phylogeny of the ant tribe Myrmicini (Hymenoptera:
Formicidae)
Journal: Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society
Abstract:
The interrelationships within ant subfamilies remain
elusive, despite the recent establishment of the phylogeny of the major
ant lineages. The tribe Myrmicini belongs to the subfamily Myrmicinae
and groups morphologically unspecialised genera. Previous research has
struggled with defining Myrmicini, leading to considerable taxonomic
instability. Previous molecular studies have suggested non-monophyly of
Myrmicini but they have been based on limited taxon sampling. We
investigated the composition of Myrmicini with phylogenetic analyses of
an enlarged set of taxa, using DNA sequences of seven gene fragments
taken from representatives of six of the seven genera (Eutetramorium,
Huberia, Hylomyrma, Myrmica, Manica and Pogonomyrmex). Our results
demonstrate the invalidity of Myrmicini as currently defined. We
recovered sister-group relationships between the genera Myrmica and
Manica, and between Pogonomyrmex and Hylomyrma. This study illustrates
that to understand the phylogeny of over 6000 myrmicine species,
comprehensive taxon sampling and DNA sequencing are an absolute
requisite
